pages.text: $(li)Ropes can be placed against a ceilling, on a $(l:patchouli:decoration/others/fences)Fence$(/l), $(l:patchouli:decoration/others/walls)Wall$(/l) or next to other ropes.$(br)$(li)Just like $(l:patchouli:utility/vanilla/scaffolding)Scaffolding$(/l) they can only go that far out horizontally from they are no longe supported.$(br)$(li)Vertical ropes have no hitbox and can be climbed.
pages.title: Rope (Inspirations)

pages.text: $(li)Horizontal ropes do have a hitbox and can be walked on, albeit at a slower paste. Your screen will also wobble as you try to balance on them.$(br)$(li)Can be broken by a projectile. Doing so or breaking them will also break connected ropes which are being supported.$(br)$(li)Shearing a rope will make remove its bottom connection.
$(li)Placing a rope against an existing vertical one will result in the rope getting extended downwards, pushing all blocks that are attached to the bottom most rope.

$(li)The opposite is also true and can be achieved by shift clicking a rope with an empty hand. This will pull up the last attached block.$(br)$(li)Ropes can be placed and will dynamically wrap themselves against many fence like blocks such as walls, beams and posts.$(br)$(li)Falling down ropes will not slow you down but still prevent fall damange.
$(li)Vine Rope has the same features than the ropes.
